title: Progress Bar
description: Progress bars are used to give users feedback on the status of a running process, like a file upload or a multi-step form.

overview.title: Overview of Progress Bars
overview.description: Progress bars visualize the advancement of an operation. A 'determinate' bar shows how much of the task is complete (e.g., 60%), while an 'indeterminate' bar shows that an operation is ongoing without a known completion time.

html.title: HTML Structure
html.description: The structure consists of a container element and an inner element whose width is adjusted to show progress. For indeterminate bars, an animating element is used inside an overflowing container.

css.title: CSS Styling
css.description: Styling is minimal, focusing on the container and the progress indicator. The key part for an indeterminate bar is the CSS animation that creates a continuous motion effect, providing visual feedback of activity.

js.title: JavaScript Logic
js.description: JavaScript is used to dynamically update the width of a determinate progress bar based on the task's progress. For indeterminate bars, JS is typically not needed for the animation itself, which is handled by CSS.

quiz.title: Progress Bar Quiz
quiz.description: Test your knowledge on progress bars.

questions.question: When would you use an indeterminate progress bar?
answers: When the duration of the task is known
When the duration of the task is unknown
